title: Future Forms: Will, Going to, and Present Continuous
description: Learn different ways to talk about future plans, predictions, and arrangements.

rules.title: Will for Predictions and Spontaneous Decisions
rules.explanation: Use 'will + base verb' for predictions based on opinion and for decisions made at the moment of speaking.

examples.sentence: I think it will rain tomorrow.
The phone is ringing. I'll answer it.
Don't worry, I'll help you with that.

rules.title: Will for Promises and Offers
rules.explanation: Use 'will' to make promises, offers, and requests.

examples.sentence: I promise I will be on time.
I'll carry that bag for you.

rules.title: Going to for Plans and Intentions
rules.explanation: Use 'be going to + base verb' for plans decided before speaking and for predictions based on evidence.
rules.structure: Subject + am/is/are + going to + base verb

examples.sentence: I'm going to study medicine at university.
Look at those clouds! It's going to rain.
examples.translation: 저 구름 좀 봐요! 비가 올 것 같아요.

examples.sentence: She's going to have a baby in June.

rules.title: Present Continuous for Arrangements
rules.explanation: Use Present Continuous for definite future arrangements, especially with a specific time or place.

examples.sentence: I'm meeting John at 3 o'clock tomorrow.
We're flying to Paris next Monday.

rules.title: Comparing Future Forms
rules.explanation: Choose the right future form based on the situation: prediction (will/going to), plan (going to), arrangement (present continuous), spontaneous decision (will).

examples.sentence: I'm starting Japanese classes next week. (arrangement)
examples.translation: 다음 주부터 일본어 수업을 시작해요. (정해진 일정)

rules.title: Future Time Expressions
rules.explanation: Common time expressions used with future tenses.

exercises.question: Look at those dark clouds. It _____ rain.
The phone is ringing! I _____ (get) it.
I've decided. I _____ apply for that job.
We _____ (have) dinner at 7 o'clock. Would you like to join us?
I promise I _____ be late again.
I think she _____ pass the exam. She studied hard.
They _____ (fly) to London tomorrow. Their tickets are booked.
Which sentence is about a spontaneous decision?
Put in order: going / are / to / where / you / travel / ?
exercises.answer: Where are you going to travel?
